description.narrative: The Developmental Leadership Program (DLP) is an independent international research initiative that “explores how leadership, power and political processes drive or block successful development” (www.dlprog.org). Based at the University of Birmingham (UoB), it is funded by the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) through a strategic partnership. Funding will support DLP to influence the international development community, helping to forward the governance agenda and leveraging Australia’s voice in international fora and debates, consistent with DFAT’s Effective Governance Strategy (http://dfat.gov.au/about-us/publications/Pages/effective-governance-strategy-for-australias-aid-investments.aspx). DLP is now reaching the end of its second phase (DLP2), scheduled for August 2018. This invtestment will design a future phase of partnership, to capitalise on the appetite for research into the politics of development, power and leadership that DLP2 has helped to generate
